titlestmt.titleproper: American Society of Landscape Architects Records
titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Manuscript Division staff

profiledesc.creation:
Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division,
2010

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: American Society of Landscape Architects Records 1899-1966 (bulk 1925-1955)
did.abstract: Correspondence, letterbooks, subject files, reports from chapters and committees, printed material, and other records of the organization.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The records of the American Society of Landscape Architects were given to the Library of Congress by the organization in 1969.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The records of the American Society of Landscape Architects were arranged and described in 1970-1971. The finding aid was revised in 2010.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Copyright in the unpublished writings of the American Society of Landscape Architects in these papers and in other collections of papers in the custody of the Library of Congress has been dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The records of the American Society of Landscape Architects are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, American Society of Landscape Architects Records, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Organizational History
bioghist.p: The American Society of Landscape Architects, the national professional association representing landscape architects, was founded in 1899 to establish landscape architecture as a profession, develope educational opportunities in the field, and provide a voice of advocacy for the profession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records of the American Society of Landscape Architects span the years 1899-1966, with the bulk of the material dating from 1925 to 1955. The collection includes general correspondence, subject files, letterheads of society members, reports from chapters and committees, books, and letterbooks of outgoing correspondence. The records are organized into the following series: General Correspondence, Subject File, Chapter and Committee Reports, Letterheads of Members, Books, and Letterbooks.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in six series:

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports of meetings, printed matter, and miscellaneous items relating primarily to the organization's chapters and committees.

arrangement.p: Arranged by key word as supplied by the organization.
